intro: Synaedrys llanosii, commonly known as the llano sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly found in grasslands and wetlands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to form dense stands, contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat. Synaedrys llanosii is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
